title: Zlatan Ibrahimovic hints at La Liga return after LA Galaxy stint
text:
Zlatan Ibrahimovic has spent 18 months at LA Galaxy (Picture: Getty)

Former Manchester United forward Zlatan Ibrahimovic has hinted he could join a La Liga club following his 18-month stint with LA Galaxy.

The Swede moved to the States in 2018 but the Galaxy’s 5-3 defeat to rivals LAFC in the play-offs last week is expected to be his final appearance for the club.

The 38-year-old is famously confident and insisted in September that he could still play up front for former club Manchester United.

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer dismissed the prospect of a return but Ibrahimovic clearly believes he still has what it takes to play at the top.

The veteran released a video onto his social media channels today in which he claimed he will return to Spain.

"Hola España. Guess what… I'm coming back." What's Zlatan Ibrahimovic hinting at here then? 🇪🇸👀 pic.twitter.com/YPZul5CyHH — Metro Sport (@Metro_Sport) October 29, 2019

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘Hola Espana, guess what? I’m coming back,’ said Ibrahimovic.

Of course, Ibrahimovic may just be teasing a return to Spain in some form and may not necessarily be joining a La Liga club.

But the Swede will undoubtedly feel that he has unfinished business in Spain after his single season with Barcelona.

Ibrahimovic joined the Catalans in 2009 but he clashed with Pep Guardiola, who he accused of ‘treating a Ferrari like a Fiat’ during his time the Camp Nou.

The Swede joined Milan on loan the following summer, before making a permanent move to the San Siro.
